climbs.name: Time Flies When You're Having Fun

content.description:
Start with both hands on the largest rail. Find feet, mostly just smearing at this point. Work your way up to the next horizontal rail with good hands. Mantel over the sloppy top (the crux move).  

  All holds on "Hand Cannon" are off.
content.location: This is the leftmost route on the main cliff.

content.description: Get up on ledge on the left of the crag, and then follow the flakes to the second ledge. Getting up on the first ledge is a tough 5.10 type move. Then the flakes are an easy 5.8 cruise, maybe easier.
content.protection: Set a toprope anchor off of the pine tree center of the crag.
content.location: Start at obvious ledge on the left.

content.description: Knob Crack is a super nice, natural line. Start matched in the big triangle-shaped pocket. Move up and left through the series of cracks. Stay tight to squeeze past the oak tree. Good jugs to top out.
content.protection: A couple pads past the tree.
content.location: This ascends the crack with the oak tree in front of it.

content.description: Start low in vertical slash crack with some finger locking and gastoning. Find a left foot to establish yourself. Move up straight up the crack via some gritty holds. There is a nice hand jam at the top for pulling the lip.
content.protection: A couple of pads, a spotter, and tape. There is an awful sloped landing. Pad stacking helps, but be prepapared to slide.
content.location: This is the far left end of the main wall heading up the hill. It is the second to last route after tree. See the photo.

content.description: Start to the right of the small cave. Follow the route straight up to the pine directly on the cliff edge.  There's a nice ledge halfway up. The crux is the undercling crimp before the ledge.
content.protection: You can use a tree anchor for a toprope.
content.location: This is in the middle of face to the right of the small cave.

content.description: See the description for Fessenden Crag.
